intro: Anthistiria ciliata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leafed anthistiria, is a variant of the anthistiria plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The variety glabrescens is distinguished by its smoother, less hairy foliage compared to the typical form. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or riverine habitats. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
